name: TripFindr - Invite Plan Trip
description:
Join Our Funding Round

Group Travel is hard to do, annoying to organise and travel agents are still using technology that was built in the 80's and modern travel search companies are not focused on group travel meaning their product offerings are not quite right.

Here at TripFindr group travel is at the heart of everything we do.

team.title: Founder
team.name: Alexander Gash
team.bioHtml: Founder @TripFindr - Invite Plan Trip , Co-Founder @Marylebone - Difference Marketing

jobs.title: Design + Frontend Developer CoFounder
jobs.description:
We are building the worlds first group booking tool which allows groups of friends to invite, plan and book all in one place. We are solving a difficult issue and we need your help. We are looking for a mid-senior designer and frontend whizz who can help us build our initial MVP on top of the backend work we have done. 

We don't want time wasters. We have been through 3 designers who talk the talk but don't walk the walk and end up wasting time and delaying the project. (we are not getting paid for this right now and we need someone who understands what it means to be a co-founder at an early stage)

You will be joining two co-founders, a travel technology specialist and a marketer/connector/entrepreneur. We are currently deep in the development of our backend offering but need resource as to get the solution into the hands of customers and help back up our offering when pitching to angels and VC's. (sexy backend travel frameworks are not enough to get us funding, unfortunately)

About the role, you are going to lead, manage and be in charge of the frontend and design of the applications under the direction of the founder and technical direction of our CTO. 

Create mockups and prototypes for internal and external testing with a suitable level of fidelity
Communicate your design decisions clearly and be prepared to lead brainstorms, present your work and respond to feedback
Oversee user experience improvements and new features from conception through the development of our MVP and beyond
Validate design decisions using qualitative, quantitative data and common sense 
Evaluate the outcome of your work and the impact on key metrics such as customer conversion and retention
Take full ownership and responsibility for every last detail
Be autonomous and self-motivated
Be experienced enough to manage a small team of designers and front-end developers. 

What are we looking for from you?
5+ years experience in user-centred design for digital products
A solid pair of frontend coding hands
Thorough understanding of UX practices and methodologies
An excellent eye for visual design, typography, colour and layout
Deep knowledge of your chosen screen design and prototyping tools (e.g. Sketch, inVision, Framer, Adobe CC)
Experience designing for web technologies, their opportunities and limitations (HTML, CSS, JS), including best practices for web accessibility
A portfolio showcasing your work

What's in it for you?
A co-founder position, +10% equity stake, collaborate with an experienced team and base salary upon secured funding.
